CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 24, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "Brutal Murder Draws Crowd - A crowd of several hundred persons gathered soon after word of the brutal slaying of 100-year-old George Howard in bed of his basement apartment at 708 Junilla Street, last Wednesday or Thursday, spread through the Hill District. The aged pensioner was bludgeoned to death either by a thief or thieves or someone intent on wreaking vengeance on him, homicide detectives believe.  The victim was found by an ice man when the latter stopped to deliver Howard's regular order of ice around noon Thursday.  The Courier photographer was on the scene to bring Courier readers a short pictorial story of events as they transpired.  Left to right: (1) Shocked members of the family break down in tears at the doorstep upon learning that Mr. Howard had been murdered... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Family members of murder victim George Howard embracing outside of his apartment, 708 Junilla Street, Hill District
